meanings.definition: The main house or headquarters of a religious order.
meanings.sent1: The motherhouse of the nuns was where they gathered for prayer and meals.
meanings.sent2: The motherhouse of the convent was a large building with beautiful gardens.
meanings.sent3: The nuns decided to have a dance party at the motherhouse, much to the surprise of the locals.
meanings.sent4: The motherhouse stood tall like a beacon of faith in the community.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the motherhouse felt like stepping into a peaceful sanctuary.

meanings.definition: The original or principal house of a community or organization.
meanings.sent1: The small cottage served as the motherhouse for the farming cooperative.
meanings.sent2: The motherhouse of the company was where all the important decisions were made.
meanings.sent3: The children turned their clubhouse into a pretend motherhouse for their games.
meanings.sent4: The motherhouse of the town was where the town hall meetings took place.
meanings.sent5: The motherhouse symbolized the unity and strength of the community.
